message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DL 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with unsupervised training for a translation task. Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of word classes, which is a common technique in natural language processing. 

The paper also involves the use of the expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm, which is a popular machine learning algorithm used in various sub-fields of computer science. This could place the paper in the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also discusses the use of a sparse lexicon and thresholding scheme, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as these techniques are commonly used in information retrieval tasks. 

Finally, the paper involves large-scale unsupervised translation tasks, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.DL (Deep Learning) as deep learning techniques are commonly used in natural language processing tasks.
